definitions.definition: teach (a person or animal) a particular skill or type of behavior through practice and instruction over a period of time.
examples: the plan trains people for promotion
synonyms: break in; upskill "an engineer trained in remote-sensing techniques"

definitions.definition: be taught through practice and instruction.
synonyms: take instruction; upskill "she's training to be a hairdresser"

definitions.definition: cause (a mental or physical faculty) to be sharp, discerning, or developed as a result of instruction or practice.
examples: an alert mind and trained eye give astute evaluations

definitions.definition: cause (a plant) to grow in a particular direction or into a required shape.
examples: they trained roses over their houses

definitions.definition: undertake a course of exercise and diet in order to reach or maintain a high level of physical fitness, typically in preparation for participating in a specific sport or event.
examples: she trains three times a week

definitions.definition: cause to undertake a course of physical exercise.
examples: the horse was trained in Paris

definitions.definition: reduce one's weight through diet and exercise in order to be fit for a particular event.
point or aim something, typically a gun or camera, at.
examples: the detective trained his gun on the side door
synonyms: focus; zero in "she trained the gun on his chest"

examples: Charles trained to Chicago with Emily

definitions.definition: entice (someone) by offering pleasure or a reward.
a series of railroad cars moved as a unit by a locomotive or by integral motors.
synonyms: monorail; Moreinformaliron horse; baby talkchoo choo "the train for Youngstown"

definitions.definition: a succession of vehicles or pack animals traveling in the same direction.
a retinue of attendants accompanying an important person.
examples: retinue, entourage, cortège, following, staff, household a minister and his train of attendants
you may be setting in motion a train of events that will cause harm

definitions.definition: a series of gears or other connected parts in machinery.
a long piece of material attached to the back of a formal dress or robe that trails along the ground.
a trail of gunpowder for firing an explosive charge.
